title: Brake Problems
description: Diagnose brake issues on the Kymco People S 125i scooter including disc and drum brakes.

nodes.text: What brake issue on your People S 125i?

nodes.warning: Brake fluid damages paint. Wipe spills immediately.
nodes.instructions: Check the reservoir on the right handlebar. Fluid between MIN and MAX marks. Low fluid = worn pads or leak. Dark fluid = needs replacement. The People S 125i uses DOT 4 fluid.

nodes.warning: Metal-on-metal = do not ride. Damages disc.
nodes.instructions: Look through caliper opening. New pads = 4-5mm. Replace at 1-1.5mm. Grinding = worn to metal. Also check disc for grooves or warping.
Check slide pins move freely, piston extends evenly, no fluid leaks. The People S 125i has a single-piston sliding caliper. Seized slides cause uneven wear.
Find the adjusting nut at the rear brake arm. Tighten for 10-20mm lever free play. If maxed out, shoes need replacement.
Center stand the scooter. Spin each wheel. A dragging brake stops the wheel quickly.

nodes.warning: Pump lever several times before riding. Bed in new pads with gentle stops.
nodes.details: Remove caliper, slide out old pads, push piston back, install new ones. Check disc thickness. Bed in for 100 km.

nodes.warning: Use DOT 4 only. Never mix types.
nodes.action: Flush and replace all brake fluid.
nodes.details: Replace every 2 years. Bleed until clean, clear fluid flows from the caliper.

nodes.action: Clean disc and pads with brake cleaner.
nodes.details: Sand glazed pads with 120-grit. Apply anti-squeal compound to pad backs.

nodes.action: Clean and lubricate caliper slide pins.
nodes.details: Most common scooter caliper issue. Clean pins, apply silicone grease, reinstall.

nodes.warning: Stuck piston = unsafe brake. Do not ride until fixed.
nodes.action: Rebuild with new seals or replace caliper.
nodes.details: Rebuild kits available. If bore is pitted, replace entire caliper.

nodes.warning: Brake leak = potential brake failure. Do not ride.
nodes.action: Find and fix the leak source.
nodes.details: Check banjo bolts, brake line, caliper seals. Bleed after repair.

nodes.action: Bleed air from the brake system.
nodes.details: Pump, hold, open nipple, close, release. Repeat until no bubbles. Keep reservoir topped up.
Maintain 10-20mm free play. Frequent adjustment means shoes are wearing.

nodes.warning: Do not blow brake dust. Wipe with damp cloth.
nodes.details: Remove rear wheel, replace shoes and springs, clean drum. Adjust cable. Bed in for 100 km.

nodes.action: Lubricate or replace sticky brake cable.
nodes.details: Try lubrication first. Replace if frayed or kinked. Route same as original.

nodes.action: Adjust cable free play and check return springs.
nodes.details: Provide 10-20mm free play. Replace weak return springs.
